title: Albury Hotspurs eye Cup win after last year semi - final loss . | The Border Mail
body_text:
Women's league champions Albury Hotspurs say the disappointment of a semi-final exit in last year's Albury Wodonga Football Association Cup knockout is the motivation in Saturday's decider.
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
'Spurs fell to Melrose FC 4-2 last year as the latter won through to its first Cup grand final since 1986 and the pair will meet in the Cup grand final at Lavington Sportsground.
"It's really made us hungry and want it a lot more," 'Spurs' teenager Daisy Tuksar said.
Tuksar is one of the handful of players in the team studying their HSC at Albury High School.
"It's motivated us a lot, gives us a good reason to come back strong and try to win," school and team-mate Alex Ventress offered.
Melrose's win in last year's Cup semi stopped 'Spurs claiming the triple crown after snaring the league and FA Cup titles.
In the league race, Melrose had finished 23 points behind 'Spus in the regular season, only adding to the semi upset.
It now has the chance to stop a fourth championship after 'Spurs added the inaugural Riverina Cup to their league and FA Cup victories.
'Spurs won this year's league crown by seven points from Melrose FC.
"Their strengths are probably their long-range shots and how physical they are and they know how to use their bodies," Tuksar explained.
The decider starts from 2.50pm.
